alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 8:16PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cumberland County through 900 PM CDT... At 815 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Spring City, or 11 miles south of Crossville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Crab Orchard and Lake Tansi. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 328 and 339. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for Middle Tennessee.
